description.narrative: Red Nacional de Mujeres en Defensa de la Madre Tierra (National Network of Women in Defense of Mother Earth) (RENAMAT) will use the funds to raise awareness about the environmental degradation and violation of women's and communities' rights from mining activities in La Paz, Oruro, Cochabamba, and Potosi de Bolivia. Mining in these areas has reduced and contaminated water sources, and a recent mining law has given mining operators rights over the affected communities. The situation has severely impacted women, who are the dominant working force in the agricultural activities in the region. In order to empower local women and to fight the mining industry's destructive activities, the organization will organize meetings between organization members and grassroots women. These meetings will focus on defining mechanisms of resistance. The group will create workshops for 100 women from mining affected communities. The workshops will educate the women about environmental legislation, mining laws, and laws against violence toward women. RENAMAT will distribute videos and information pamphlets about environmental violence against women. Finally, the organization will arrange national meetings for women to discuss solutions, and will organize public resistance acts against the mining activities and violation of women's rights.
